snippet.textDisplay: My band once told me they wanted to start playing more “black keys” like music. I started playing a random riff and they were like yea that sounds like black keys! I didnt listen to black keys at the time. I then started listening to black keys, and found that i wrote an existing black keys song ive never heard, while trying to write a song that sounds like the black keys. super weird. It was Hard Row. The most simple riff in the world.
snippet.textOriginal: My band once told me they wanted to start playing more “black keys” like music. I started playing a random riff and they were like yea that sounds like black keys! I didnt listen to black keys at the time. I then started listening to black keys, and found that _i wrote an existing black keys song ive never heard, while trying to write a song that sounds like the black keys._ super weird. It was Hard Row. The most simple riff in the world.

snippet.textDisplay:
These meek and shallow cases of copyright infringement really shit on the important role that lawsuits have played in many of the United States' activist movements.

It's pretty disgraceful, seeing people like this turn the legal system from a pulley made to uplift the vulnerable into a gun made to point at people's heads.
snippet.textOriginal:

It's pretty disgraceful, seeing people like this turn the legal system from a pulley made to uplift the vulnerable into a gun made to point at people's heads.

snippet.textDisplay:
Music is such an old concept now and only so many combinations of beats and chords exist in the universe. Some songs sound similar due to that whether its intentional or not. Its physically impossible to make a good sounding song that doesn't sound similarly to another song. Not only that, but Drew is right, all artists no matter what kind of artist you are, take inspiration from other artists. I personally as a painter take inspiration from many other painters and use their techniques and styles in order to strengthen and enhance my own art. If the plagiarism is intentional, then that's one thing, but I feel like with many artists that isn't the case.

Also: those songs sound nothing alike really at all, other than they have the same beat. The instruments are different, and even if they were almost the same, their styles of singing and their genres are so different that honestly, why does it matter? They're too different imo at that point for it to matter. Also, there is such a thing as buying samples of music from other songs and I don't think enough people know about that.
snippet.textOriginal:
Music is such an old concept now and only so many combinations of beats and chords exist in the universe. Some songs sound similar due to that whether its intentional or not. Its physically impossible to make a good sounding song that doesn't sound similarly to another song. Not only that, but Drew is right, all artists no matter what kind of artist you are, take inspiration from other artists. I personally as a painter take inspiration from many other painters and use their techniques and styles in order to strengthen and enhance my own art. If the plagiarism is intentional, then that's one thing, but I feel like with many artists that isn't the case. 

Also: those songs sound nothing alike really at all, other than they have the same beat. The instruments are different, and even if they were almost the same, their styles of singing and their genres are so different that honestly, why does it matter? They're too different imo at that point for it to matter. Also, there is such a thing as buying samples of music from other songs and I don't think enough people know about that.

snippet.textDisplay:
Please, if you can, donate to the Australian Red Cross at https://www.redcross.org.au/
Australia has such a large, diverse, and extraordinary ecosystem that is at risk due to the fires. Already, ~500,000,000 animals have died, and the fire is showing little signs of stopping. The Australian prime minister is blind to the imminent catastrophe going on in his country, so it seems that it's up to people like to us to help support and fund the prevention of this terrible natural disaster.
